course_description: History of the cultural, intellectual, and artistic expressions of the Caribbean, as they relate to the forced and voluntary encounters of Native, European and African peoples and the socio-economic structures of global capitalism since the 15th century. It serves both as its homonymous course at ECAS and as complement to Span_OX 335.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 4326, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: P. Palomino, Status: Closed
